Hmmm....sounds like you're trying to over-engineer the problem.

Why not have a unit test for the database connection.  If that 
fails, then all your database dependant tests fail, you know that 
the connection could not be established due to the DB connection 
test.  The fact that the other tests fail as a side effect is 
somewhat irrelevant.

The other suggestion I saw about doing asserts in setup could be 
used, too.  Or, something I currently do (an idea blatantly stolen 
from my co-workers), if testing some pre-existing condition is to 
simply notate:

assertEquals("Test setup: This should be zero initially", 0, 
someClass.Value());

Then if a 'test setup' assert is thrown, you know that there was 
something wrong before you even made it to the asserts you were 
really testing.  Very useful, simple, and doesn't require some grand 
mechanism.

-Eric
